perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in Attachments A, G or H, neither party can suspend its further performance, terminate this Agreement or require specific performance of the other party of this Agreement in whole or in part as a result of the other party's material breach of the terms and conditions of this Agreement without first providing notice to such party in writing and thirty (30) days' opportunity to cure the material breach (and then only if such party fails to cure such breach).
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in Attachments A, G or H, either party can suspend its further performance, terminate this Agreement or require specific performance of the other party of this Agreement in whole or in part as a result of the other party's material breach of the terms and conditions of this Agreement without providing notice to such party in writing and thirty (30) days' opportunity to cure the material breach. In such case, both parties are required to mutually agree to make specific actions regarding the situation, and a formal investigation shall be held to decide whether the party at fault can solve the issue at hand. A full detailed report will be drafted in order to have all details on paper to present to the executive commitee of both parts and they shall decide if the contract will be terminated or amended accordingly.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that neither party could terminate the agreement without providing a 30-day cure period. The modified version removes this certainty by stating that parties can, in fact, terminate the agreement without notice in the event of a breach, and adding a convoluted process for solving such issues. This creates uncertainty regarding the termination procedure.

perturbation.original_text:
Buyer and Seller agree to convene once every calendar year to discuss annual Product quantities. Buyer has provided Seller with an annual non- binding forecast for the respective contract year.

As requested by the Seller, the Buyer will provide a quarterly forecast for the subsequent contract years. Seller will provide Buyer a quarterly overview of the planned production run of each Butyl grade purchased for Buyer.

Seller shall acknowledge in writing the requested delivery and timing of Products and Volumes.
perturbation.changed_text:
Buyer and Seller agree to convene once every calendar year to discuss annual Product quantities. Buyer has provided Seller with an annual non- binding forecast for the respective contract year.

As requested by the Seller, the Buyer may provide a quarterly forecast for the subsequent contract years. Seller may provide Buyer a quarterly overview of the planned production run of each Butyl grade purchased for Buyer.

Seller shall acknowledge in writing the requested delivery and timing of Products and Volumes.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that Seller MUST provide Buyer a quarterly overview of the planned production run of each Butyl grade purchased for Buyer. The modified version removes this certainty by stating that parties MAY do this. This creates uncertainty regarding to planned production.
perturbation.location: COLLABORATION PLANNING AND SUPPLY ASSURANCE, FORECAST

perturbation.original_text:
Product shall conform to ExxonMobil Selling Affiliates' standard sales specifications as of the date of shipment.

Sellers agrees to support the creation of purchasing specifications for Products by Buyer and agrees to supply Products in accordance to those purchasing specifications. Seller has the right to review each purchasing specification and needs to accept in writing before such purchasing specifications become effective. Seller has the right to take exceptions to terms and provisions in these purchasing specifications if in contradiction with Seller's Sales specifications, General Terms and Condition of Sales or other Seller's procedures and policies.
perturbation.changed_text:
Product shall conform to ExxonMobil Selling Affiliates' standard sales specifications as of the date of shipment.

Sellers agrees to support the creation of purchasing specifications for Products by Buyer and agrees to supply Products as close as possible in accordance to those purchasing specifications. Seller has the right to review each purchasing specification and does not need to accept it. Seller has the right to take exceptions to terms and provisions in these purchasing specifications. The final determination of what products will be supplied is at the seller discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that Seller agrees to supply Products in accordance to those purchasing specifications. The modified version removes this obligation by stating that products shall be supplied as close as possible to those specifications, and that the final discretion of the final product to provide is at the seller discretion. The product specifications are not clear, and it can cause disputes between parties.
